content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic pancreatic pleomorphic carcinoma with PDGFRα mutation

Staging:
Stage IV at diagnosis with widespread hepatic and peritoneal metastases
Initial CT 15 March 2024 showing 6.8cm pancreatic mass with multiple liver deposits

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
Chronic kidney disease stage 3

Current medications:
Gemcitabine/nab-paclitaxel
Lansoprazole 30mg od
Oxycodone MR 40mg bd
Oxycodone IR 5mg prn

Allergies:
Penicillin - severe rash

Current situation:
Pre cycle 4 gemcitabine/nab-paclitaxel

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is experiencing increasing difficulties with treatment. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2-3, spending approximately 60% of the day resting. There has been a 4kg weight loss over the past 3 weeks despite dietetic input. Significant fatigue and anorexia persist.

CT scan performed last week shows disease progression with 30% increase in liver metastases and new peritoneal deposits. CA19-9 has risen from 2500 to 4800.

Today's blood tests show deteriorating liver function with bilirubin 45, ALT 156, ALP 445. Albumin has dropped to 28. Platelets remain adequate at 178.

On examination, there is marked peripheral edema and tender hepatomegaly. Ascites is now clinically apparent.

In view of disease progression and declining performance status, we have agreed to discontinue chemotherapy. I have referred to palliative care and arranged weekly community nurse reviews. Will organize hospice assessment. Next oncology review in 2 weeks with focus on symptom control.
